revisionDesc.change: split composite text and converted to unicode

ab.note:
ad summam quis postea
Haasius :
qui postea ad summam .

l.note:
ambit
margin ed . of Tornaesius :
amat .

histrionis ad rictus
O . Ribbeck :
histrioni addictus .

ab.note:
qui diverti contubernium
Buecheler :
quid . i . verticontubernium .

venirent
Buecheler :
veniret .
After
veniret
the MSS . place the poem
quid faciant , etc . (
p .
18 ) :
it is transposed to its present position by Buecheler .

l.note:
vendere vera solent
cod . Vossianus
( verba
L
) : verba solent emere
other MSS .

ab.note:
dupondium sicel lupinosque
L
quibus destinaveramus
MSS . : corrected by Gronovius , Buecheler and an unknown scholar mentioned by Boschius .

sopitionibus ,
probably corrupt :
sopionibus
MSS . of Catullus
37 , Io : ropionibus
Hertz .

procedentibus
Burmann on authority of “ Old MS . “ :
prodeuntibus .

multaciam
corrupt : Buecheler suggests
multa iam .

Topanta
is colloquial for the Greek
+
ta \ pa / nta
“
all .
”

Saplutus
is the Greek
za / ploutos
“
very rich .
”

Babae babae
is an exclamation ofsurprise . So
babaecalis
in the next sentence is a person always agape with wonder , a lout .

Some words such as
bene vixit
have clearly dropped out .

Simila si siligine inferior esset
Buecheler :
similia sicilia interiores et .

redibant
Jacobs :
ridebant udi
Triller :
ut dii .

sic ut vivere
Heinsius :
sicuti vere .

patrono meo Mummius
Buecheler :
patronorum meus .

fortunatam suam revertebatur modo ad naturam
MSS . , corrected by Heinsius and Buecheler .

Some words such as
in brachium
have clearlyfallen out .

l.note:
Heinsius would supply
ubique , nostra ,
to fill the gap between
fit
and
et .

tibi , bacam Indicam .
Heinsius :
tribaca Indica

e cod . Bernensis :
est
other MSS .
carbunculis
Buecheler :
carbunculus-o–s
or
—as .

ab.note:
xerophagi ex sapa
Friedlaender :
aecrophagie saele .

maiiesto
Buecheler following Muncker :
mali isto .

caldicerebrius
Jahn :
caldus cicer eius : sed
added by Buecheler .

qui de nobis
Buecheler :
quidem vobis .

nos
added by Jacobs , who read
nos magis .

in tota via
Scheffer :
matavita tau .

zacritus
Roensch ;
caccitus .
A Latin rendering of the Greek
dia / kritos ,
excellent . Cf . notes on c .
37 .

improbiter nos pugno
corrected by Buecheler .

sequitur
Buecheler :
sequatur .
The phrase , like
in fronte
and
in agrum
above , is written with Horace Satires i ,
8 , 12–13 ,
in mind .
H . M . H . N . S .
is a common inscription on tombs .

vaporabatur
Buecheler :
pervapatur ( in
marg .
parabatur ) .

suas
marked for deletion in MS .

femina , domini , dominae
bracketed by Buecheler .

alter die qui tanquam togae
MSS .

insistere
cod . Messaniensis :
inspicere
other MSS .

cultissima
cod . Paris .
6842
D :
consultissima
other MSS .

l.note:
mens semper
cod . Autissiodurensis :
mendatium semper
cod . Paris .
6842
D :
mendacium
other MSS .

ponto
Sambucus , Tornaesius :
pontem L : pontum O .

ab.note:
exciperem
margin ed . of Tornaesius
exciperet .

et non
bracketed ,
ut
added by Buecheler .

Baiis in tetrastylo
Buecheler :
Baistor asylo .

flavum
margin ed . of Tornaesius :
flaucorum .

spintriam
margin ed . of Tornaesius :
spuicam
or
spuitam .

iunctos nos mare
Faber :
iuncta nos mors .

umentibus
margin ed . of Tornaesius :
viventibus .

feliciorem
cod . Messaniensis :
faciliorem
other MSS .

vanitatem
cod . Messaniensis :
sanitatem
other MSS .

concipere
cod . Bernensis :
conspicere
L :
conspici
O .

Aes Ephyreiacum
Heinsius :
aes epyrecum
and the like most MSS . :
spolia Tum ( cum
Dr
) Senius
codd . Monacensis et Dresdensis .

vilius
Gronovius :
vilibus .
For
imitatur
some MSS . give
mutatur .

vanos
Delbenius :
vanus
O :
varios
L .

adulti
cod . Messaniensis :
adusti
other MSS .

te
Buecheler :
tu
L :
eu
O .

Magnum
cod . Messaniensis :
Magnaque
other MSS .

doctos— — amare
Dousa :
doctus — — in arte .

septifluus
most MSS . :
semperflavius
cod . Bernensis
: vestifluus
Turnebus :
semper ovans
Buecheler .

actu
margin of L :
astu
or
hastu .

hoc
Goldast :
hac coniecturam ducebat
Dousa :
coniectura dicebat .
